text: Johanna Clementina Hudig, also known as Han Hudig (Groningen, March 27, 1907 - Amersfoort, July 29, 1996) was the first female judge in the Netherlands. From 1947 to 1977, she was a juvenile judge attached to the Rotterdam court. From 1957 to 1972, she was attached to the University of Utrecht as extraordinary professor of children's rights and child protection. == References == Category:1907 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Dutch judges Category:Dutch women jurists Category:People from Groningen (city) Category:Utrecht University faculty
title: Johanna Clementina Hudig
